text.p: UMMARY OF NOTICE OF BOND SALE
SWEET HOME CENTRAL SCHOOL DISTRICT
OF AMHERST AND TONAWANDA
ERIE COUNTY, NEW YORK
GENERAL OBLIGATIONS
SCHOOL DISTRICT SERIAL BONDS, 1997

SEALED PROPOSALS will be received by the undersigned President of the Board of Education of the Sweet Home Central School District of Amherst and Tonawanda, Erie County, New York (the "Issuer"), at the offices of Nixon, Hargrave, Devans & Doyle LLP, 437 Madison Avenue, 24th Floor, New York, New York, until 10:30 A.M., Prevailing Time, on

at which time and place they will be publicly opened and announced, for the purchase in FEDERAL FUNDS at a price not less than par and accrued interest, of $6,100,000 School District Serial Bonds, 1997 of the Issuer (the "Bonds"), dated July 15, 1997, and maturing on July 15 in each year, and in the amounts as set forth below:
Year Amount Year Amount Year Amount
2002 400,000 2007 450,000 2012 450,000 The Bonds shall bear interest at the rate or rates per annum specified by the successful bidder therefor in
accordance herewith, payable on July 15, 1998 and

semiannually thereafter on January 15 and July 15 of each year until maturity. The Bonds maturing on or after July 15, 2008 shall be subject to redemption prior to maturity, as described in the Preliminary Official Statement, dated June 19, 1997. The Bonds will be issued in fully registered form and when issued will be registered in the name of Cede & Co., as nominee of the Depository Trust Company, New York, New York ("DTC"). DTC will act as Securities Depository for the

Bonds. Individual purchases will be made in book-entry-only form, in the principal amount of $5,000, or any integral multiple thereof. Purchasers will not receive certificates representing their interests in the Bonds. Each bid must be for all of the $6,100,000 Bonds and must state in a multiple of one hundredth of one per centum or one eighth of one per centum the rate or rates of interest per annum which the Bonds are to bear and may state different rates of interest for Bonds maturing in different calendar years, provided, however that (i) only one rate of interest may be bid for Bonds maturing in any one calendar year; (ii) variations in rates of interest so bid shall be in ascending progression in order of maturity so that the rate of interest on Bonds maturing in any particular

calendar year shall not be less than the rate of int applicable to Bonds maturing in any prior calendar year; and (iii) the highest interest rate so bid shall not exceed the lowest interest rate so bid by more than one and one-half percent (1/%). Each bid must be enclosed in a sealed envelope addressed to the undersigned President of the Board of Education and should be marked on the outside "Proposal for School District Serial Bonds, 1997" and should be accompanied with a certified or cashier's check drawn upon an incorporated bank or trust company to the order of the Issuer for $122,000 as a good faith deposit to secure the Issuer against any loss resulting from the failure of the bidder to comply with the terms of his bid. No interest will be

allowed on the amount of the good faith deposit. Unless all bids are rejected, the Bonds will be awarded and sold to the bidder complying with the terms of sale and offering to purchase the Bonds at the lowest net interest cost. If two or more such bidders offer the same lowest net interest cost, then the Bonds will be awarded and sold to one of said bidders selected by the undersigned Treasurer by lot from among all said bidders. The right is reserved by

the Issuer to reject any or all bids, and any bid not complying with this Notice of Sale will be rejected. The Bonds will be delivered to DTC and shall be paid for in FEDERAL FUNDS on or about July 15, 1997, at such place in New York City, and on such business day and at such hour, as the undersigned Treasurer shall fix on three business days' notice to the successful bidder, or at such other place and time as may be agreed upon with the successful bidder. The

deposit of the Bonds with DTC under a book entry system requires the assignment of CUSIP numbers prior to delivery. It shall be the responsibility of the successful bidder to obtain CUSIP numbers for the Bonds prior to delivery. The Bonds will be designated "qualified tax exempt

obligations" pursuant to the provisions of Section 265 of the Code. Copies of the complete Notice of Sale and the Preliminary Official Statement, dated June 19, 1997, may be obtained upon request to the offices of Nixon Hargrave Devans & Doyle LLP, 437 Madison Avenue, New York, New York 10022, (212) 940-3046.
Dated: June 23, 1997 JAMES J. CARLIN
President of the Board of Education
(From The Bond Buyer)
